Package model.abstractModel

Class Game

java.lang.Object
util.Observable<Game.Event>
model.abstractModel.Game
Direct Known Subclasses:
StandardGame
public abstract class Game extends Observable<Game.Event>
This is the abstract class for games.

It defines all the required methods needed to access game components and status and to manage game's turn sequence.

    Game.Event
    This enumeration contains all the game events that can be sent to observers

    This enumeration represents all the statuses of the game

  • Method Details

    • getGameStatus

      public abstract Game.GameStatus getGameStatus()
      This method returns the current game status
      Returns:
      the current game status

    • close

      public abstract void close()
      This method signal the game to end and close

    • setLastTurn

      public abstract void setLastTurn()
      This method marks the current turn sequence to be the last one.

      If invoked then isLastTurn method will return true

    • isLastTurn

      public abstract boolean isLastTurn()
      This method returns true if the current turn sequence is the last one
      Returns:
      true if the current turn sequence is the last one

    • getTurnPlayerId

      public abstract String getTurnPlayerId()
      This method returns the playerId of the player that has currently the turn.
      Returns:
      if(getGameStatus().equals(GameStatus.STARTED) the playerId of the player that has currently the turn, empty otherwise

    • updatePlayersTurn

      public abstract void updatePlayersTurn() throws GameEndedException
      This method gives the turn to the next player
      Throws:
      GameEndedException - if turn can't be given to the next player because game is ended

    • addPlayer

      public abstract void addPlayer(String playerId) throws PlayerAlreadyExistsException, MatchmakingClosedException
      This method adds a new Player to game, the new Player is referenced by playerId. After this method has been invoked with success the same Player can be obtained via getPlayer(playerId)
      Parameters:
      playerId - the new id that has to be associated to the new Player
      Throws:
      PlayerAlreadyExistsException - when there is already a Player associated to playerId
      MatchmakingClosedException - when not getGameStatus().equals(GameStatus.MATCHMAKING)

    • removePlayer

      public abstract void removePlayer(String playerId) throws PlayerNotExistsException
      This method removes a Player from the game, the Player is referenced by playerId. After this method has been invoked with success then getPlayer(playerId) will throw PlayerNotExistsException
      Parameters:
      playerId - the id of the player that needs to be removed
      Throws:
      PlayerNotExistsException - if there is no Player associated to playerId

    • getPlayer

      public abstract Player getPlayer(String playerId) throws PlayerNotExistsException
      This method returns the Player associated to the playerId
      Parameters:
      playerId - the id of the Player requested
      Returns:
      the Player associated to the playerId
      Throws:
      PlayerNotExistsException - if there is no Player associated to playerId

    • getCommonGoals

      public abstract List<CommonGoal> getCommonGoals()
      This method returns a copy of the list of common goals of the game
      Returns:
      a copy of the list of common goals of the game

    • getLivingRoom

      public abstract LivingRoom getLivingRoom()
      This method returns the living room of the game
      Returns:
      the living room of the game

    • getInfo

      public abstract GameInfo getInfo()
      This method returns a GameInfo representing this object instance
      Returns:
      A GameInfo representing this object instance
